result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Lee Strickland

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 004497,
Payable Number: 92287,
Receipt Number: 22R 007171,
Amount: $20.00

10:49 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Strickland appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rock in court for Brandon Lee Strickland.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 21CF155, 22CF98, 2CF128 & 22CF239
Atty Rock does not represent def on case 22CF239
DA is being heard on bond
Atty Rock is being heard
Court is being heard regarding 21CF155 - Jury Trial and PTC already scheduled
22CF239, 22CF98 & 22CF128 - already scheduled
11:07 AM

8:47 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Strickland appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has not contacted the Public Defender.
Does not qualify and does not want to be represented by any atty from the Public Defender.
Deft would like to represent himself in this case.
DA heard on Deft's other cases and the atty representing him on those.
Has contacted that office and was notified they were not representing on this case.
Court speaks to Deft regarding self-representation.
Court schedules with parties.
Deft heard and requests a speedy trial.
Court speaks - not the appropriate time to request that.
8:50 AM
Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Strickland appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Brad Hansen is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed with Deft and Deft understands.
Deft is represented by another Attorney on his other cases in this County.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $10,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no contact with any known drug users, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today and including any form of THC w/o a valid Rx.
Deft to contact his atty today and if he will not represent, then Deft to contact the Public Defender today
10:37 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
